org.gridgain.grid.spi.discovery.tcp.ipfinder.jdbc
Class GridTcpDiscoveryJdbcIpFinder

java.lang.Object
  org.gridgain.grid.spi.discovery.tcp.ipfinder.GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinderAdapter
      org.gridgain.grid.spi.discovery.tcp.ipfinder.jdbc.GridTcpDiscoveryJdbcIpFinder
All Implemented Interfaces:
GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinder
public class GridTcpDiscoveryJdbcIpFinder
extends GridTcpDiscoveryIpFinderAdapter

JDBC-based IP finder.

Configuration

Mandatory

  • Data source (see GridTcpDiscoveryJdbcIpFinder.setDataSource(DataSource)).

Optional

There are no optional configuration parameters.

The database will contain 1 table which will hold IP addresses.

Method Detail

getRegisteredAddresses

public Collection<InetSocketAddress> getRegisteredAddresses()
                                                     throws GridSpiException
Gets all addresses registered in this finder.

Throws:
GridSpiException - In case of error.
Returns:
All known addresses, potentially empty, but never null.

registerAddresses

public void registerAddresses(Collection<InetSocketAddress> addrs)
                       throws GridSpiException
Registers new addresses.

Implementation should accept duplicates quietly, but should not register address if it is already registered.

Throws:
GridSpiException - In case of error.
Parameters:
addrs - Addresses to register. Not null and not empty.

unregisterAddresses

public void unregisterAddresses(Collection<InetSocketAddress> addrs)
                         throws GridSpiException
Unregisters provided addresses.

Implementation should accept addresses that are currently not registered quietly (just no-op).

Throws:
GridSpiException - In case of error.
Parameters:
addrs - Addresses to unregister. Not null and not empty.

setDataSource

@GridSpiConfiguration(optional=false)
public void setDataSource(DataSource dataSrc)
Sets data source.

Data source should be fully configured and ready-to-use.

Parameters:
dataSrc - Data source.

toString

public String toString()
